attributes.action: Stop The Royal Mail from profiteering from the Covid 19 crisis
attributes.additional_details:
I feel the charge to businesses, during the current crisis, is excessive. The businesses have been forced to close in order to protect the public and the NHS. 

Many businesses, especially shops, have shutters etc which protect the premises, but also prevent pist from being able to be delivered. 

I would like the Government to speak with the Royal Mail and encourage them remove the charge for the delivery, until such time as businesses are allowed to operate normally once again
attributes.background:
The Royal Mail is refusing to hand over business mail stored at it's delivery offices and is forcing them to take out a redirection, at the cost of £216. This is blatant profiteering from the current crisis.

Many currently closed businesses do not have any way for post to be delivered.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.
